conclusion: To determine the work done externally by the gas from state A to state B, analyze the process on the given p-V diagram.
The process from A to B is a horizontal line on the p-V diagram, indicating constant pressure.
The process from A to B is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The pressure at state A (and hence at state B) is 1 x 10^5 Pa.
The volume at state A is 3 L and the volume at state B is 4 L.
The change in volume (ΔV) is 4 L - 3 L = 1 L.
The change in volume is 1 L = 1 x 10^-3 m³.
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = P ΔV.
Substituting the values, W = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m³) = 100 J.
Since the gas expands from state A to state B, the work done by the gas is positive.
The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
